text: Peter Rosenbrock (21 November 1939 – 5 January 2005) was an Australian rules footballer who played with Collingwood in the Victorian Football League (VFL) during the early 1960s. Rosenbrock was a key defender, used mostly at full- back by Collingwood. He didn't play in the first five rounds of the 1960 season but played every other game for the rest of the year, including Collingwood's grand final loss.AFL Tables: Peter Rosenbrock A broken leg sustained early in the 1963 VFL season kept him out of the side for the rest of the year and he wasn't able to make his way back.The Age,"Moving Well", 4 March 1964, p. 13 ==References== Category:1939 births Category:Australian rules footballers from Victoria (Australia) Category:Collingwood Football Club players Category:Frankston Bombers players Category:2005 deaths
title: Peter Rosenbrock
